publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1999 Pauline McNeill: Glasgow - A Fair Trade Cityâ€”That the Parliament supports the investigation undertaken by Glasgow City Council in order to achieve fair trade status; commends the growing awareness of people in Scotland of the issues surrounding fair trade and the desire to be involved in such a positive way to tackle the injustice of poverty, and recognises the ongoing importance of fair trade as an effective way of empowering disadvantaged producers through receiving a fairer deal.
S2M-1999 Glasgow - A Fair Trade City (lodged on 12 November 2004) Michael Matheson*

S2M-1999 Glasgow - A Fair Trade City (lodged on 12 November 2004) Maureen Macmillan*, Mike Pringle*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Eleanor Scott*, Bill Butler*, Mark Ballard*, Stewart Stevenson*, Marlyn Glen*, Rosie Kane*, Jackie Baillie*, Elaine Smith*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Patrick Harvie*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Brian Adam*, Christine May*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Donald Gorrie*

S2M-1999 Glasgow - A Fair Trade City (lodged on 12 November 2004) Chris Ballance*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Des McNulty*, Karen Gillon*, Mike Watson*, Tommy Sheridan*, Nora Radcliffe*, Trish Godman*, Helen Eadie*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-1999 Glasgow - A Fair Trade City (lodged on 12 November 2004) Robin Harper*, Sarah Boyack*
S2M-1999 Glasgow - A Fair Trade City (lodged on 12 November 2004) Susan Deacon*
S2M-1999 Glasgow - A Fair Trade City (lodged on 12 November 2004) Frances Curran*
